definition: to allow (sb to do as he pleases)
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
smile (archaic)
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to lean against/to rely on/on the basis of/no matter (how, what etc)/proof
variant of 憑|凭[ping2]

sentences.english: it was true that the rescued cruel man let fuel oil issue from the tissue.
sentences.chinese: 得到挽救的无情须眉真的听凭燃油从薄纱中流出。

sentences.english: Never avenge yourselves, but leave room for the wrath of God;
sentences.chinese: 不要自己申冤，宁可让步，听凭主怒。

sentences.english: A virtuous person chest without care, let destiny without hardship.
sentences.chinese: 有德者胸无牵挂，听凭天命而没有忧患。

sentences.english: The company had let environmental standards slide .
sentences.chinese: 这家公司听凭环境标准的不断下降。

definition: to let (sth happen)/to allow (sb to do sth)/to submit to/to yield
to obey an order/to take orders/to accept a state of affairs
to allow (sb to have his head)/to let things happen
to wait for (orders, a decision, a judgment)
to arrange/to order about/to manipulate
obedient/to comply/to submit/to defer
to let (sb do sth)/to allow/regardless of
to listen and obey/to comply with/to heed/to hearken
to consider and decide
to decide/to make decisions/to take responsibility (for deciding)/to be in charge/to give sb justice
to deal with (an offender)
to comply with/to obey
to disobey/to defy/deliberately going against (rule, convention, sb's wishes etc)
to disobey/to defy an edict/to violate/to go against/to run counter to
in accordance with
let (one) have his way/as (one) pleases/at (one's) will
